com.edugility.maven.liquibase

Class AggregateChangeLogGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edugility.maven.liquibase.AggregateChangeLogGenerator

  • public class AggregateChangeLogGenerator
extends Object
    A generator that creates a Liquibase changelog file with <include> elements inside it referencing other Liquibase changelog fragments.

    This class is chiefly for use by a LiquibaseChangeLogArtifactsProcessor.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    LiquibaseChangeLogArtifactsProcessor, The documentation for the artifact-maven-plugin, The Liquibase homepage, Documentation relating to the Liquibase changelog file

    • Constructor Detail

      • AggregateChangeLogGenerator

    • Method Detail

      • getDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion

        public String getDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion()
        Returns the version of the Liquibase changelog file that will be generated.

        This method may return null in which case "3.3" will be used internally instead.

        By default, "3.3" is returned, and this default value will change when Liquibase is updated and this project is updated to depend on it.

        Returns:
        the version of the Liquibase changelog file that will be generated, or null
        See Also:
        setDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion(String)

      • setDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion

        public void setDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion(String version)
        Sets the version of the Liquibase changelog file that will be generated.
        Parameters:
        version - the new version; may be null
        See Also:
        getDatabaseChangeLogXsdVersion()

      • getResource

        protected URL getResource(String name)
        Loads a notional resource with the given name from the classpath.

        The default implementation invokes the ClassLoader.getResource(String) method on the supplied String using, in order:

        1. the context ClassLoader
        2. this class' ClassLoader

        The first of these ClassLoaders to return a non-null value will have its result returned. Otherwise, the return value of ClassLoader.getSystemResource(String) is returned.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource to load; may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        the resource that was found, or null
        See Also:
        ClassLoader.getResource(String)

      • getProperties

        public Properties getProperties()
        Returns a Properties object representing any custom properties that are to be converted to Liquibase changelog parameters.

        This method may return null.

        Returns:
        a Properties object representing custom properties, or null
        See Also:
        setProperties(Properties)

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(Properties properties)
        Installs a Properties object that represents custom properties that are to be converted to Liquibase changelog parameters.
        Parameters:
        properties - the Properties to be installed; may be null
        See Also:
        getProperties()

      • getCharacterSet

        public String getCharacterSet()

      • setCharacterSet

        public void setCharacterSet(String characterSet)

      • getTemplate

        public String getTemplate()
        Returns the source code of an MVEL template that represents the skeleton of a Liquibase changelog into which will be placed <include> elements.

        This method will not return null and overrides of it must not either.

        Returns:
        a non-null String containing the source code of an MVEL template

      • setTemplate

        public void setTemplate(String template)
        Sets the source code of an MVEL template that will be used to produce a Liquibase changelog.
        Parameters:
        template - the new source code; must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if template is null
        See Also:
        getTemplate()

      • getAggregateChangeLogFile

        public File getAggregateChangeLogFile()
        Returns a File that either does house or will house Liquibase changelog contents.

        This method may return null.

        This method may generate such a file.

        Returns:
        a File representing the aggregate changelog, or null
        See Also:
        generateEmptyAggregateChangeLogFile()

      • setAggregateChangeLogFile

        public void setAggregateChangeLogFile(File file)
        Installs a File representing the path to a file that will be erased and that will eventually contain Liquibase changelog contents.
        Parameters:
        file - a path to a file that will be used as the Liquibase changelog file generated by this AggregateChangeLogGenerator; may be null

      • generateEmptyAggregateChangeLogFile

        protected File generateEmptyAggregateChangeLogFile()
                                            throws IOException
        Generates an empty (temporary) File that will eventually contain Liquibase changelog contents.

        This implementation calls File.createTempFile(String, String) with changelog and .tmp.xml as its arguments, instructs the File so created to be deleted when the Java Virtual Machine exits and returns the result.

        Returns:
        a non-null File
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • generate

        public File generate(Collection<? extends URL> resources)
              throws IOException
        Generates a Liquibase changelog file that, from a high level, logically contains the Liquibase changelog fragments reachable from the supplied URLs.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        resources - a Collection of URLs, each element of which resolves to a Liquibase changelog file; may be null or empty in whihc case a generally useless changelog will be generated
        Returns:
        a non-null File representing the path to the generated file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs
        IllegalStateException - if somehow the File into which content will be poured is null
        See Also:
        getAggregateChangeLogFile(), generateEmptyAggregateChangeLogFile()
